meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Alright, let's get this review party started!

I'm diving into Crime Boss: Rockay City, a game that's got everyone from IGN to Metro GameCentral talking... and not in a good way. But hey, I love a good underdog story, so let's see what this crime caper has to offer.

First off, the gameplay. It's like trying to run a successful heist with a bunch of bumbling amateurs - it's all about timing, planning, and execution (or lack thereof). You'll be taking on various missions, from bank robberies to warehouse raids, and it's not too shabby... until you hit those pesky bugs. And boy, do they love to crash the party.

Now, I know some of my fellow critics might say that Crime Boss is a bit of a mess, but hey, we all have our off days, right? IGN called it an "air ball" (ouch), while Game Informer thought it was "painfully dull." Even SpazioGames, who gave it a somewhat higher score, noted that it felt "not-so-polished."

But I'm not one to write off a game without giving it some love. After all, Crime Boss has got some great concepts - like the roguelike elements and co-op play. And hey, if you're looking for a good time with friends, this might be your ticket... as long as you don't mind getting killed by cheap AI every now and then.

GamingTrend's review was all about what could've been, and I gotta agree - Crime Boss has some real potential hidden beneath its rough exterior. And Hardcore Gamer, bless their heart, thought it was a great fit for fans of rogue-like games and 90s crime flicks... even if it is a bit repetitive.

So, will you find yourself swept up in the world of Rockay City? Maybe, maybe not. But hey, at least it's only $40 (or less with a sale). And who knows - you might just have some fun while trying to make sense of this crime-ridden mess.
